p: Synthesis of 1-(2-hydroxyethyl)-3-methylimidazolium chloride ( 3) [ 36]. In an MW vial, 5 g of 1-methylimidazole (0.061 mol) and 5.39 g of 1-chloroethanol (0.067 mol) were consequently added, and then the reaction was irradiated (200 W) for 15 min at 100 °C. After cooling, the solid product that precipitated off the solution was washed with Et 2O and then dried under vacuum to yield 8.89 g (0.05 mol) of 1-(2-hydroxyethyl)-3-methylimidazolium chloride 3 (90% yield). 1H-NMR (200 MHz, DMSO- d 6, ppm): δ = 9.33 (s, 1H), 7.79 (m, 2H), 5.50 (bs, OH), 4.23 (t, 2H, 4.8 Hz), 3.86 (s, 3H), 3.67 (t, 2H, J = 4.8 Hz).
